subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Noun
Synonyms
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|たまき|yomi=k}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=たまき|手|tr1=ta|t1=hand|pos1=ancient combining form of modern ''te''|巻き|tr2=maki|t2=winding, wrapping|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|巻く}} ''maku'', “to wind, to wrap”}}, from the way that the bracelet would be worn around the wrist.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|たまき}}

# an ancient [[bracelet]] strung with jewels or bells and worn at the elbow
# a longer tube-shaped [[gauntlet]] to protect the hand during [[archery]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=たまき|obsolete}} an ancient [[jewel]] or other [[stone]] in the shape of a ring

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text:
* {{sense|archery gauntlet}} {{ja-r|手覆|たおおい}}
* {{sense|ring}} {{ja-r|指輪|ゆびわ}}, {{lang|ja|環}} (''yubimaki'') {{qualifier|see below}}

subSections.title: Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆびまき}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=ゆびまき|指|tr1=yubi|t1=finger|pos1=ancient combining form of modern ''te''|巻き|tr2=maki|t2=winding, wrapping|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|巻く}} ''maku'', “to wind, to wrap”}}, from the way that the ring would be worn around a finger.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ゆびまき}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ゆびまき|obsolete}} an ancient [[jewel]] or other [[stone]] in the shape of a ring
